I used to be a non-believer. I did not care much about astrology and used to mock the discussions and rituals around this topic. I was living a very happy, active and mentally healthy life. I was quite successful in whatever I was doing. Then an era started when my Mom got my kundali reviewed by a well qualified astrologer. He mentioned that my sadhe-saati and some planetary transition was about to begin. He mentioned that I will remain fickle minded during that tenure and my labour won’t produce fruitful results. I overheard this conversation and got worried. After some time the predictions started manifesting. I became fickle minded. Any plan which was not giving early signs of fruitful results, I used to change that. I was mentally worried and always used to remain in a state of confusion. I discussed this with my Father and told him how I overheard this conversation and how true those predictions were. I developed a strong respect for that astrologer. Then my father laughed. He made me realise that how my belief in the predictions and a change in the state of mind due to the fear of anticipation had led me to disaster. I realised how right he was. With a very light heart I started mocking the predictions and laughed at my judgement. My state of mind became happier. Which in turn resulted to determined efforts . Its been around 12 years and I did not face any kind of problem due to planetary transitions. For every problem I was able to figure out the root cause. I live a very healthy & mentally happy life till now. Hence I would say that astrology has changed my life twice. Once for the disaster and once for the enlightenment. Astrology might or might not be true but remaining away from it might be the best thing you could do to yourself. Do not be weak minded or weak hearted. Do not remain in confusions. Do not overthink. Do whatever you want with positive frame of mind and a sheer determination. Things will automatically take care of themselves.
